item.title: Yahoo CEO Marissa Mayer Resigns As Verizon Completes $4.5 Billion Purchase
item.description: June 13, 2017 - Verizon has completed its $4.5 billion purchase of Yahoo, and, as expected, Yahoo CEO Marissa Mayer is resigning. She's turning over control to Tim Armstrong, the former CEO of AOL who is now the head of Oath, a digital media brand that combines the Internet assets of AOL and Yahoo. Verizon sees the acquisition of media content as a way to expand beyond its core wireless business.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 13, 2017 - Verizon has completed its $4.5 billion purchase of Yahoo, and, as expected, Yahoo CEO Marissa Mayer is resigning. She's turning over control to Tim Armstrong, the former CEO of AOL who is now the head of Oath, a digital media brand that combines the Internet assets of AOL and Yahoo. Verizon sees the acquisition of media content as a way to expand beyond its core wireless business. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/13/532816953/yahoo-ceo-marissa-mayer-resigns-as-verizon-completes-4-5-billion-purchase

item.title: Verizon Closes The Yahoo Deal; Yahoo CEO Marissa Mayer Resigns
item.description: June 13, 2017 - Verizon has completed its $4.5 billion acquisition of Yahoo, folding it and AOL into a digital media subsidiary called Oath. Mayer is expected to receive a $23 million golden parachute as she exits.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 13, 2017 - Verizon has completed its $4.5 billion acquisition of Yahoo, folding it and AOL into a digital media subsidiary called Oath. Mayer is expected to receive a $23 million golden parachute as she exits. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/06/13/532772877/verizon-closes-the-yahoo-deal-yahoo-ceo-marissa-mayer-resigns

item.title: Could Drones Help Save People In Cardiac Arrest?
item.description: June 13, 2017 - AED-carrying drones beat ambulance times to the sites of previous cardiac arrest cases in a rural area of Sweden, a study finds. But this has yet to be tried in real emergencies.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 13, 2017 - AED-carrying drones beat ambulance times to the sites of previous cardiac arrest cases in a rural area of Sweden, a study finds. But this has yet to be tried in real emergencies. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/13/532639836/could-drones-help-save-people-in-cardiac-arrest

item.title: At 'Washington Post,' Tech Is Increasingly Boosting Financial Performance
item.description: June 13, 2017 - The newspaper struggled amid declines in print ads, but under Amazon's Jeff Bezos, it has transformed its operations, from how it writes headlines and chooses photos to how it generates ad dollars.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 13, 2017 - The newspaper struggled amid declines in print ads, but under Amazon's Jeff Bezos, it has transformed its operations, from how it writes headlines and chooses photos to how it generates ad dollars. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/06/13/531099577/at-washington-post-tech-is-increasingly-boosting-financial-performance

item.title: History Of Our Time: Software's Power To Replace Humans
item.description: June 13, 2017 - Rachel Martin talks to Jaron Lanier, a Silicon Valley pioneer, who offers some solutions to the impact of technology on our livelihoods and our humanity.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 13, 2017 - Rachel Martin talks to Jaron Lanier, a Silicon Valley pioneer, who offers some solutions to the impact of technology on our livelihoods and our humanity. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/13/532724722/history-of-our-time-softwares-power-to-replace-humans

item.title: India's Tech Firms Face Fundamental Shift From IT To More Advanced Tech
item.description: June 13, 2017 - For decades India's IT talent has maintained the world's computers, databases and back offices. But new technologies are overtaking that old business model, and analysts predict massive layoffs.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 13, 2017 - For decades India's IT talent has maintained the world's computers, databases and back offices. But new technologies are overtaking that old business model, and analysts predict massive layoffs. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/06/13/530876721/indias-tech-firms-face-fundamental-shift-from-it-to-more-advanced-tech

item.title: The Covfefe Act Has A Silly Name — But It Addresses A Real Quandary
item.description: June 12, 2017 - In an era of unfiltered tweets from the president, Rep. Mike Quigley's bill would require the archiving of the president's social media posts — from official and personal accounts.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 12, 2017 - In an era of unfiltered tweets from the president, Rep. Mike Quigley's bill would require the archiving of the president's social media posts — from official and personal accounts. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/06/12/532651827/the-covfefe-act-has-a-silly-name-but-it-addresses-a-real-quandary

item.title: Pakistan Sentences Man To Death For 'Blasphemy' On Social Media
item.description: June 12, 2017 - Amnesty International says this is the country's harshest sentence yet for a cybercrime related offense. The Pakistani government is pushing a campaign against blasphemy on social media.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 12, 2017 - Amnesty International says this is the country's harshest sentence yet for a cybercrime related offense. The Pakistani government is pushing a campaign against blasphemy on social media. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/06/12/532632860/pakistan-sentences-man-to-death-for-blasphemy-on-social-media

item.title: Uber Considers Leave Of Absence For CEO Travis Kalanack
item.description: June 12, 2017 - Despite phenomenal growth and popularity with users, Uber's troubles are mounting. The ride hailing company has been rocked by a sexual harassment scandal, top executives have quit, and there are reports that CEO and co-founder Travis Kalanack may take a leave of absence. Employees and investors tell NPR that Uber faces a more challenging problem — its fractured relationship with drivers.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 12, 2017 - Despite phenomenal growth and popularity with users, Uber's troubles are mounting. The ride hailing company has been rocked by a sexual harassment scandal, top executives have quit, and there are reports that CEO and co-founder Travis Kalanack may take a leave of absence. Employees and investors tell NPR that Uber faces a more challenging problem — its fractured relationship with drivers. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/12/532645968/uber-considers-leave-of-absence-for-ceo-travis-kalanack

item.title: Notaries Are Starting To Put Down The Stamp And Pick Up A Webcam
item.description: June 12, 2017 - Technology and new laws are taking notarizations digital, adding them to the list of things you can do on your phone or computer. However, America's 4 million notaries are split on the idea.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 12, 2017 - Technology and new laws are taking notarizations digital, adding them to the list of things you can do on your phone or computer. However, America's 4 million notaries are split on the idea. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/06/12/532586426/notaries-are-starting-to-put-down-the-stamp-and-pick-up-a-webcam

item.title: This Baker Makes Internet Trolls Eat Their Words — Literally
item.description: June 12, 2017 - Tempted to respond back to Internet harassers? New York City baker Kat Thek does just that. Her company, Troll Cakes, will find your perpetrator and send them a cake with their words written on it.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 12, 2017 - Tempted to respond back to Internet harassers? New York City baker Kat Thek does just that. Her company, Troll Cakes, will find your perpetrator and send them a cake with their words written on it. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/06/12/529747366/this-baker-makes-internet-trolls-eat-their-words-literally

item.title: Uber Drivers Confront Challenges Working For A 'Faceless Boss'
item.description: June 9, 2017 - Drivers say Uber feels more like a faceless boss — setting strict rules and punishments, but eerily hard to reach, even in emergencies.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 9, 2017 - Drivers say Uber feels more like a faceless boss — setting strict rules and punishments, but eerily hard to reach, even in emergencies. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/09/532288993/uber-drivers-confront-challenges-working-for-a-faceless-boss

item.title: Taylor Swift Returns To Spotify, Amends Her Relationship To Streaming
item.description:
June 9, 2017 - The pop superstar announced her 'return' to streaming, but it's more complicated than that.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/therecord/2017/06/09/532238490/taylor-swift-returns-to-spotify-amends-her-relationship-to-streaming

item.title: Canada's Tech Firms Capitalize On Immigration Anxiety In The Age Of Trump
item.description: June 9, 2017 - "We feel that Canada has a window of opportunity here to be able to attract the best and the brightest," says one Canadian tech leader.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: The Faceless Boss: A Look Into The Uber Driver Workplace
item.description: June 9, 2017 - To recruit drivers, company leaders are fond of saying that at Uber, you can "Be Your Own Boss." But NPR found that many Uber drivers feel controlled by a boss that is both always there, yet faceless.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 9, 2017 - To recruit drivers, company leaders are fond of saying that at Uber, you can "Be Your Own Boss." But NPR found that many Uber drivers feel controlled by a boss that is both always there, yet faceless. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/06/09/531642304/the-faceless-boss-a-look-into-the-uber-driver-workplace
